question.text:
Match the columns: -
 
  Column – I (Organism)   Column – II (Mode of Reproduction)
1 Penicillium A Offset
2 Agave B Bulbils
3 Water Hyacinth C Conidia
4 Hydra D Buds

options.text: <math><mn>1</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

<math><mn>1</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

<math><mn>1</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>→</mo><mo>∆</mo><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

solution.text:
Asexual reproductive structures like :

(i) Zoospores. Examples : Members of Kingdom Fungi and simple plants like algae (Chlamydomonas).

(ii) Conidia. Example : Penicillium.

(iii) Buds. Example : Hydra.

(iv) Gemmules. Example : Sponges.

Vegetative reproduction - It occurs by structures known as vegetative propagules which are of

following types :

(i) Rhizome. Example : Ginger.

(ii) Eyes (or buds). Example : Potato.

(iii) Bulbils. Example : Agave.

(iv) Leaf buds. Adventitious buds arise from the notches present at margins of leaves.

Examples: Bryophyllum.

(v) Offset. Example : Water hyacinth.
